page.title: 04Leighfield Access Problems
page.content: The major routes adjacent to the block are the A47 Leicester to Peterborough road to the south, and to the north the A606 Nottingham to Stamford (A1) road. The main problem with living in the area is that it is too far from these routes and there is no direct access to them. The topography of steep sided valley with no road running along the bottom makes access difficult. The road to Leigh Lodge Farm was formerly the main route to Market Harborough from Oakham because the bridge there was the only crossing point of the River Chater. People tend to live in villages surrounding the area where public transport is available.
